page.title: 03Life Styles
page.content: The area is quite well catered for by its 21 public houses and other licensed premises such as hotels and working men's clubs. There are many interesting names of pubs. The Volunteers Arms relates to the old use of pubs as enlistment centres, whilst the Albion was the old Roman and Greek name for England. The Hare and Hounds and The Greyhound are linked with the once popular 'sport' of coursing. The Walmesley Arms pays deference to the Dunkenhalgh family whilst the Forts Arms is linked with a local family of calico printers. The Oddfellows Arms recalls the friendly society of that name - an organisation which met in this and many other pubs in the area.
